type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"NewsArticle","mainEntityOfPage":"https://www.timesnownews.com/business-economy/companies/tiktok-can-still-access-years-of-indians-data-despite-ban-this-is-ceo-shou-zi-chews-response-when-grilled-by-the-us-congress-article-98955792","url":"https://www.timesnownews.com/business-economy/companies/tiktok-can-still-access-years-of-indians-data-despite-ban-this-is-ceo-shou-zi-chews-response-when-grilled-by-the-us-congress-article-98955792","articleBody":"Washington DC:  TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew was, on Thursday, grilled by the US Congress for over five hours as the US lawmakers raised concerns about the company's risks to national security. India's ban on TikTok was also brought up during the questioning. US Lawmaker Debbie Lesko referred to India and New Delhi's ban on TikTok citing data privacy concerns. \"India banned TikTok in 2020. On March 21, a Forbes article revealed how data of Indian citizens who used TikTok remained accessible to employees at the company and its Beijing-based parent. A current TikTok employee told Forbes that nearly anyone with basic access to company tools can easily look up the closest contact and other sensitive information about any user,\" Lesko said in one of her questions.In response to the references regarding bans by other countries including India, Chew said that the risks pointed out by these countries are 'theoretical' and misleading. \"I think a lot of risks pointed out are hypothetical and theoretical risks. I have not seen any evidence,\" Chew said.India's TikTok banIndia banned TikTok, WeChat and other Chinese apps in 2020, citing privacy and national security concerns. The ban came after the Indian and Chinese soldiers clashed along the Line of Actual Control. The ban was made permanent in January 2021.\"There have been raging concerns on aspects relating to data security and safeguarding the privacy of 130 crore Indians. It has been noted recently that such concerns also pose a threat to the sovereignty and security of our country. The Ministry has received many complaints about misuse of some mobile apps available on Android and iOS platforms for stealing and surreptitiously transmitting users’ data in an unauthorized manner to servers which have locations outside India,\" the government had said regarding its ban on TikTok.","datePublished":"2023-03-24T08:03:35+05:30","dateModified":"2023-03-24T08:03:35+05:30","articleSection":"Companies","headline":"TikTok can still access years of Indians' data despite ban? India's ban on TikTok was also brought up during the questioning. </div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem">US Lawmaker Debbie Lesko referred to India and New Delhi's ban on TikTok citing data privacy concerns. "India banned TikTok in 2020. On March 21, a Forbes article revealed how data of Indian citizens who used TikTok remained accessible to employees at the company and its Beijing-based parent. A current TikTok employee told Forbes that nearly anyone with basic access to company tools can easily look up the closest contact and other sensitive information about any user," Lesko said in one of her questions.</div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem">In response to the references regarding bans by other countries including India, Chew said that the risks pointed out by these countries are 'theoretical' and misleading. "I think a lot of risks pointed out are hypothetical and theoretical risks. I have not seen any evidence," Chew said.</div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem"><h2>India's TikTok ban</h2></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem">India banned TikTok, WeChat and other Chinese apps in 2020, citing privacy and national security concerns. The ban came after the Indian and Chinese soldiers clashed along the Line of Actual Control. The ban was made permanent in January 2021.</div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem">"There have been raging concerns on aspects relating to data security and safeguarding the privacy of 130 crore Indians. It has been noted recently that such concerns also pose a threat to the sovereignty and security of our country. The Ministry has received many complaints about misuse of some mobile apps available on Android and iOS platforms for stealing and surreptitiously transmitting users’ data in an unauthorized manner to servers which have locations outside India," the government had said regarding its ban on TikTok.</div></div><section class="trinity-skip-it"><div class="rdE5S"><div class="_2sQQR"><button><a 6318,"hostid":183,"text":"Washington DC:  TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew was, on Thursday, grilled by the US Congress for over five hours as the US lawmakers raised concerns about the company's risks to national security. India's ban on TikTok was also brought up during the questioning. US Lawmaker Debbie Lesko referred to India and New Delhi's ban on TikTok citing data privacy concerns. \"India banned TikTok in 2020. On March 21, a Forbes article revealed how data of Indian citizens who used TikTok remained accessible to employees at the company and its Beijing-based parent. A current TikTok employee told Forbes that nearly anyone with basic access to company tools can easily look up the closest contact and other sensitive information about any user,\" Lesko said in one of her questions.In response to the references regarding bans by other countries including India, Chew said that the risks pointed out by these countries are 'theoretical' and misleading. \"I think a lot of risks pointed out are hypothetical and theoretical risks. I have not seen any evidence,\" Chew said.India's TikTok banIndia banned TikTok, WeChat and other Chinese apps in 2020, citing privacy and national security concerns. The ban came after the Indian and Chinese soldiers clashed along the Line of Actual Control. The ban was made permanent in January 2021.\"There have been raging concerns on aspects relating to data security and safeguarding the privacy of 130 crore Indians. It has been noted recently that such concerns also pose a threat to the sovereignty and security of our country. Congress MP Rahul Gandhi was barred from serving in the Lok Sabha on Friday, one day after a Surat court found him guilty of criminal defamation. Rahul Gandhi would be unable to run for office for eight years following his disqualification unless a higher court overturned his conviction and sentence. The latest departures at the Falguni Nayar-led firm come amid intensifying competition and a falling stock price. The 5 executives who have left Nykaa include the chief executive of wholesale business. A company spokesperson confirmed the news on Friday, saying that Nykaa sees \"some of these mid-level exits as a part of the standard annual appraisal and transition process, wherein, people exit due to performance or to pursue other opportunities.\" \"Voluntary and involuntary exits are expected in a fast-paced, growth-focused, consumer tech organisation with over 3,000 on-roll employees, the e-commerce platform told Reuters. Executives who have quit Nykaa 1- Chief Executive Officer of wholesale business Vikas Gupta 2- Chief Commercial Operations Officer Manoj Gandhi 3 - Chief Business Officer of fashion division Gopal Asthana 4- Shuchi Pandya, a vice president of Nykaa fashion division's Owned Brands business 5- Lalit Pruthi, a vice president of finance at the fashion unit Meanwhile, Nykaa parent FSN E-Commerce Ventures, reported its October-December 2022 quarter earnings in February this year. The firm witnessed 71 per cent decline in consolidated net profit to Rs 8 crore as against Rs 29 crore in the same quarter of last year. In the same month, Nykaa had announced the appointment of Sujeet Jain, Chief Legal and Regulatory Officer of the Company as Company Secretary & Compliance Officer and Key Managerial Personnel of the Company (KMP), effective from February 14, 2023. Former investment banker Nayar started Nykaa over a decade ago and launched the company’s IPO in 2021. The company made a stellar debut on the stock market, listing at a premium of 79 per cent over the issue price of Rs 1,125 per share on the National Stock Exchange (NSE). However, Nykaa stock has plunged amid a broader rout in startups, falling around 68 per cent from the all-time high in November 2021. The stock ended slightly in green on Friday at Rs 139. Congress MP Rahul Gandhi was barred from serving in the Lok Sabha on Friday, one day after a Surat court found him guilty of criminal defamation. Rahul Gandhi would be unable to run for office for eight years following his disqualification unless a higher court overturned his conviction and sentence. There will soon be a floating jetty built for city tourists and devotees.\"For more details on this news keep watching Times Now for the latest updates.#timesnow #breakingnews #latestnews #englishnews #varanasi #englishnews"}}]},"leadVideoAutoPlay":true},{"msid":98970919,"parentid":87846318,"hostid":183,"text":"As companies continue to slash their workforce amid fear of global recession and economic uncertainty, employer rating website Glassdoor become the latest firm to announce job cuts. Blaming the \"shifting macroeconomic environment”, Glassdoor CEO Christian Sutherland-Wong on Thursday announced, the company will reduce its workforce by roughly 15 percent, affecting 140 employees. In a memo to the employees, Sutherland-Wong said that layoff would be the ‘last resort’ for the company.Glassdoor CEO Sutherland-Wong said: “Since last summer, we’ve provided regular updates on the shifting macroeconomic environment and the decisions we’ve made to operate conservatively amidst the uncertainty. From the start, we said that layoffs would be a last resort. Unfortunately, we have reached that point.” “It is with a heavy heart that I share that I have made the difficult decision to reduce our workforce. Today we are going to say goodbye to around 140 of our colleagues, who represent approximately 15% of the Glassdoor team,” he said while announcing the job cuts. Sutherland-Wong further said those employees who are in the US and whose roles are being impacted “will receive a meeting invitation (Subject: Follow Up Meeting) within the hour to meet with your manager or team lead”. “For those whose roles are not impacted, you will receive an email confirmation (Subject: Your Role is Not Impacted), also within the hour. EMEA employees will receive an invitation to either a UK or Ireland Town Hall meeting where we’ll share specific next steps for those markets,” he informed in the memo. \"This outcome is devastating and please know that we made all attempts to control costs to avoid this. We paused hiring. We cut programme costs. We cut travel and events. Unfortunately, this was not enough,\" the CEO mentioned.Reason behind the layoffs Explaining the reason behind the reduction of the workforce, Sutherland-Wong said: “Last quarter, US sponsored jobs were down 33 percent year over year. And we saw declines in retention rates for our Employer Branding customers too. It has become increasingly clear that this is just the beginning of a broader economic slowdown, as the job market cools after the post-COVID boom”. “Economic contractions tend to have an extended impact on the recruiting industry, and we anticipate declines in US job openings back to pre-pandemic levels over the next two or three years. As such, I am making difficult but necessary changes to our cost structure now to handle what we expect to be a challenging period for our business and revenue,” he added.Severance Package for affected employees The company also announced severance for the impacted employees which will include a minimum of 16 weeks of base pay and healthcare coverage for 4 months. The affected employees will also get a 100 percent payout of Spring 2023 bonus, and full payout of earned commissions and spiffs, said Glassdoor CEO. The CEO said that they are leaving Slack open for departing employees until the end of the day and have opened up a new Slack channel called – #goodbye – in which employees who are staying, and employees who are leaving, can talk, share contact information and wish each other well. “We know the relationships we all have at Glassdoor are special and we want to honor them,” he said. “It’s heartbreaking to say goodbye to such a talented group of people for reasons that are outside of their control. To those of you departing, I want to convey my deepest gratitude to each of you for your contribution to Glassdoor. Today is a very sad and emotional day, but I hope you can take pride in the meaningful work you’ve done during your time here,” the CEO said.","cmstype":"ARTICLE","status":"ACTIVE","title":"No end to layoffs? Q4 2022 recorded a 15 per cent YoY decline, hitting major OEMs' confidence and further darkening market prospects.","cmstype":"ARTICLE","status":"ACTIVE","title":"Taking on Apple? Congress MP Rahul Gandhi was barred from serving in the Lok Sabha on Friday, one day after a Surat court found him guilty of criminal defamation. The Anil Agarwal led company made the announcement after Vedanta Resources, a majority shareholder of Vedanta Ltd stated that it has enough means to meet debt repayment liabilities in the coming quarters as it looked to assuage investor concerns around its financial position, reported PTI. \"The meeting of the board of directors of the company (the board) is proposed to be scheduled on Tuesday, March 28, 2023, to consider and approve the Fifth Interim Dividend on equity shares, if any, for the Financial Year 2022-23,\" the company said in a regulatory filing.In a statement, Vedanta Resources had said it is in the advanced stage of finalisation to tie-up USD 1.75 billion through a combination of syndicate loan and bilateral bank facilities.The company had said it had pre-paid all of its debt that was due for repayment till March 2023, deleveraging by USD 2 billion in the past 11 months.Further, it is confident of meeting its liquidity requirements for the quarter ending June 2023.Vedanta Resources had recently said that it has fully repaid USD 250 million in loans it had taken from Barclays Bank and Standard Chartered Bank.","cmstype":"ARTICLE","status":"ACTIVE","title":"Vedanta dividend 2023 news: Check latest update","cmssource":"CMSLITE","parenttitle":"Companies","titleforurl":"vedanta dividend 2023 news: check latest update","synopsis":"Vedanta Ltd is all set to consider and approve its fifth interim dividend for the financial year of 2022-23 next week for its equity shares. Congress MP Rahul Gandhi was barred from serving in the Lok Sabha on Friday, one day after a Surat court found him guilty of criminal defamation. There will soon be a floating jetty built for city tourists and devotees.\"For more details on this news keep watching Times Now for the latest updates.#timesnow #breakingnews #latestnews #englishnews #varanasi #englishnews"}}]},"leadVideoAutoPlay":true},{"msid":98969633,"parentid":87846318,"hostid":183,"text":"Chief executive officers of multi-billion corporations are more likely to be found in boardrooms discussing corporate strategy or mulling plans for racking up sales, not on the frontline in front of a till serving customers. But that’s exactly what Starbuck’s new CEO Laxman Narasimhan plans to do. The cafe chain boss who officially took charge of the company from his predecessor, Howard Schultz, on Monday, announced that he will serve work as a barista once a month to know the company’s culture, customers, challenges, and opportunities. A Barista is a person who serves in a coffee bar.In a letter to employees on Thursday, the Indian-American business executive stated that he intends to continue working in stores for a half-day each month to stay close to the company's culture and customers. \"With you, I've experienced every aspect of the business to learn what it truly means to wear the green apron. You've welcomed me into our stores, trained me in how to be a ‘barista’ all to help me deeply understand what we do, how we do it, and the challenges and opportunities facing us,” he wrote.“To keep us close to the culture and our customers, as well as to our challenges and opportunities, I intend to continue working in stores for a half day each month,\" news outlet CNN quoted him as saying.Narasimhan joined Starbucks as interim CEO in October and has since spent time getting to know the company, including earning a barista certification that requires 40 hours of training in stores. \"I thought it was very important for me to put myself in the shoes of the partners and really understand what they do and how they do it,\" he said in a statement.Pune-born Narasimhan previously served as the CEO of Reckitt, a UK-based consumer health, hygiene, and nutrition company. Before that, Narasimhan held several leadership positions at PepsiCo, including global chief commercial officer and CEO of the company's Latin America, Europe, and Sub-Saharan Africa operations. Narasimhan has taken over Starbucks, a company with significant strengths, as demonstrated by its record demand in the April-June period due to strong US sales compensating for ongoing closures in China, its second-largest market.","cmstype":"ARTICLE","status":"ACTIVE","title":"From boardroom to barista! There will soon be a floating jetty built for city tourists and devotees.\"For more details on this news keep watching Times Now for the latest updates.#timesnow #breakingnews #latestnews #englishnews #varanasi #englishnews"}}]},"leadVideoAutoPlay":true},{"msid":98964496,"parentid":87846318,"hostid":183,"text":"Apart from being known as one of the leading industrialists of the country, RPG Enterprises chairman, Harsh Goenka, is also famous among Twitter users for his intriguing and interesting posts on the social media platform. Goenka, in his latest post on Twitter on March 23 (Thursday), shared a jaw-dropping video where a car could be seen crossing a subway while bouncing off the top of a container truck and then a bus, which was plying on the subway.  Industrialist Harsh Goenka shared the video of the car student and captioned it: “Perfect timing….”The post by the RPG Enterprises Chairman has garnered over 5.3 million views and 3,664 likes.Some Twitter users said that the video, which is reportedly shot in the UK, is edited, others were amused by the timing of the car driver while performing the stunt. Commenting on the post a Twitterati wrote: “Please don’t say that he was using CEAT Tyres.” Worth mentioning, CEAT Limited, an Indian multinational tyre manufacturing firm, is the flagship company of Harsh Goenka-led RPG Enterprises. “This can be said luckiest escape ever recorded.... 😱 Looks like a movie scene... How is this possible... How can be someone so lucky...,” a Twitter user said. \"Timing\", a user wrote.“Amazing!! Which Tyres was the car running on? I couldn't SeeIt (pronounced CEAT),” a user said in his comment on the latest post of Goenka.“Having the right tyres and a little bit of luck makes the difference ..,” another user said. Another user commented that the video was edited and said: “This video is created using computer graphics by Dionysis, a UK-based graphic designer. He shared it on his social media accounts and YouTube account named ‘2ncs’. More such videos created by him can be found in these accounts. Hence the claim made in the post is FALSE.”\"As I can understand, the only claim this video makes is about how perfect the timing is - which is true irrespective of the fact whether this is a real-world incident or simulated one. Do you see any other claims being made here which are false?\" another Twitterati wrote. ","cmstype":"ARTICLE","status":"ACTIVE","title":"'Perfect timing…' - GOING VIRAL! Congress MP Rahul Gandhi was barred from serving in the Lok Sabha on Friday, one day after a Surat court found him guilty of criminal defamation. There will soon be a floating jetty built for city tourists and devotees.\"For more details on this news keep watching Times Now for the latest updates.#timesnow #breakingnews #latestnews #englishnews #varanasi #englishnews"}}]},"leadVideoAutoPlay":true},{"msid":98962831,"parentid":87846318,"hostid":183,"text":"Clearing the air on the rumours of merger talks between India’s most-valued edtech companies- Aakash Educational Services and SoftBank-backed Unacademy, the parent company of Aakash, BYJU'S clarified that they are not considering any such move. As per a report of IANS on Friday, reacting to a recent report of Money Control which said, citing sources, that Gaurav Munjal-run Unacademy is in talks for a potential merger with BYJU's-owned Aakash, the company denied any such proposal being considered.         A BYJU'S spokesperson in a statement, as quoted by IANS, said: “We strongly deny that BYJU'S is considering a merger of Unacademy into Aakash Educational Services. As a parent company, BYJU'S is committed to investing in the growth of Aakash Educational Services, which is growing at more than 50 percent year-on-year,\" a BYJU'S spokesperson said in a statement. A spokesperson of Aakash said that they have had \"absolutely no discussions with Unacademy or any other player to merge with Aakash Educational Services. \"Aakash is a market leader in our segment with an impeccable track record of delivery and results and we are focused on our organic growth and delivery to the lakhs of students that have trusted us,\" the Aakash spokesperson stated. However, Unacademy declined to comment on the development.         As per IANS report, Byju Raveendran-led BYJU'S is in the advanced stages to raise $250 million at a valuation that is \"lower than the $22 billion valuation\", as announced by the company, as it struggles to repay a $1.2 billion term loan and turn profitable in 2023. Sources further said that the latest funding round is in the \"final stages of discussion and will be closed soon\". However, BYJU's also declined to immediately comment on the development. Congress MP Rahul Gandhi was barred from serving in the Lok Sabha on Friday, one day after a Surat court found him guilty of criminal defamation. The Lok Sabha Secretariat declared his disqualification, stating that it took effect as of March 23, the day of his conviction. Rahul Gandhi would be unable to run for office for eight years following his disqualification unless a higher court overturned his conviction and sentence. As many as 1,052 tech companies fired 1,61,411 people. However, the layoff wave didn’t end in 2022 but has continued to 2023 too. In this year alone, over 500 tech firms have issued pink slips to over 1,50,000 employees. The layoffs are a global phenomenon and India is not an exception to that. Numerous homegrown startups and companies have also fired thousands of workers. These include edtech major Byju’s, Unacademy, Vedantu, Swiggy, Ola, to name a few. Company-wise layoffs in India in 2023Byju’s - 4,000 Unacademy – 1,500 Ola – 1,400 Vedantu – 1,100 Swiggy - 630 Cars24 - 600 Oyo - 600 Sharechat – 600 Layoffs 2023 In a case of irony, a job platform turned a job taker when US-based employment website Indeed said it will be cutting thousands of jobs. The job search platform has laid off 2,200 employees, which accounts for 15 percent of its workforce, and with this, it became the latest firm to make massive job cuts. Meanwhile, IT services and consulting firm Accenture on Thursday joined the layoff spree as it announced a colossal number of job cuts. Global IT services firm Accenture, which has a large presence in India, on Thursday announced to lay off nearly 19,000 employees amid the challenging global macro-economic conditions and slow revenue growth.         Earlier this week, e-commerce giant Amazon said it is cutting around 9,000 jobs across various business verticals like AWS cloud unit, Twitch gaming division, advertising, and PXT (experience and technology solutions) arm in yet another round of layoffs. A few days back, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg also shared that they will be undertaking another round of layoffs soon. The round will impact 10,000 jobs. Zuckerberg also said that 5,000 of the open jobs will again be closed for hiring. Congress MP Rahul Gandhi was barred from serving in the Lok Sabha on Friday, one day after a Surat court found him guilty of criminal defamation. The Lok Sabha Secretariat declared his disqualification, stating that it took effect as of March 23, the day of his conviction. Rahul Gandhi would be unable to run for office for eight years following his disqualification unless a higher court overturned his conviction and sentence. The final decision regarding the appointment of the LIC chairman and the FSIB recommendation will be taken by the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet headed by PM Narendra Modi. According to the guidelines, the chairman is chosen from one of the four managing directors of the company. Mohanty, who is serving as the interim chairperson of LIC for a period of four months, is also the managing director of LIC.Before his current role, Mohanty was MD and CEO of LIC Housing Finance. Earlier, Siddhartha Mohanty was the Chief Operating Officer (COO) of LIC Housing Finance Limited. Mohanty started his career as a direct recruit officer with LIC of India in 1985 and has risen through the ranks to this senior position.Siddhartha Mohanty: Rise through LIC ranksIn his three-decade-long association with LIC, Mohanty has worked closely with various departments of the corporation such as HR, marketing, investments and legal. \"He has served as Chief of Investments (Monitoring), Regional Head of a marketing vertical of LIC‘s Western Zone spanning the States of Maharashtra, Gujarat and Goa. He was the Senior Divisional Manager in charge of Raipur and Cuttack divisions of LIC\" - the company had said in an exchange filing earlier.A postgraduate in Political Science with a degree in law, Mohanty also holds a postgraduate degree in business management and is a licentiate from the Insurance Institute of India. \"His innovative style of working, people orientation, marketing acumen and technical expertise have resulted in success in each of his assignments,\" the company had earlier said.","cmstype":"ARTICLE","status":"ACTIVE","title":"Once a 'direct recruit' of 1985, now in line to Congress MP Rahul Gandhi was barred from serving in the Lok Sabha on Friday, one day after a Surat court found him guilty of criminal defamation. main.articleBody: Washington DC:  TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew was, on Thursday, grilled by the US Congress for over five hours as the US lawmakers raised concerns about the company's risks to national security. India's ban on TikTok was also brought up during the questioning. US Lawmaker Debbie Lesko referred to India and New Delhi's ban on TikTok citing data privacy concerns. "India banned TikTok in 2020. On March 21, a Forbes article revealed how data of Indian citizens who used TikTok remained accessible to employees at the company and its Beijing-based parent. A current TikTok employee told Forbes that nearly anyone with basic access to company tools can easily look up the closest contact and other sensitive information about any user," Lesko said in one of her questions.In response to the references regarding bans by other countries including India, Chew said that the risks pointed out by these countries are 'theoretical' and misleading. "I think a lot of risks pointed out are hypothetical and theoretical risks. I have not seen any evidence," Chew said.India's TikTok banIndia banned TikTok, WeChat and other Chinese apps in 2020, citing privacy and national security concerns. The ban came after the Indian and Chinese soldiers clashed along the Line of Actual Control. The ban was made permanent in January 2021."There have been raging concerns on aspects relating to data security and safeguarding the privacy of 130 crore Indians. It has been noted recently that such concerns also pose a threat to the sovereignty and security of our country. The Ministry has received many complaints about misuse of some mobile apps available on Android and iOS platforms for stealing and surreptitiously transmitting users’ data in an unauthorized manner to servers which have locations outside India," the government had said regarding its ban on TikTok.
main.headline: TikTok can still access years of Indians' data despite ban? This is CEO Shou Zi Chew's response when grilled b
